Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let’ s say you start out facing forward and take 5 steps right and take 4 steps backward. The first time you are facing backward, take 5 steps right and 6 steps backward. You should then continue facing forward, take 4 steps right and 6 steps backward. Also, each time you are taking steps backward, take 4 steps right and 6 steps backward. This would then be 4 steps backward, 6 steps backward, 4 steps backward, 5 steps left (one of which is the final position), 5 steps right, 6 steps backward, 5 steps left (where the last step was), and 9 steps forward. In essence, you would take 5 steps right and 6 steps backward, taking 9 steps forward, and taking a total of 10 steps forward. Normally, with each type of forward motion, you would take 5 steps right, take one step forward, then 3 steps back. Therefore, you would continue to do all of these forward motions backward using the 1st step forward at the start of the sequence. Thus, the answer is yes.
